page.title: 13THE VILLAGE OF BURITON
page.content: {Information:}The mobile library attends fortnightly. Local information appears on the village noticeboard. {Life Style:}There are no restaurants but food is served at the Public House. Bingo games take place at the Village Hall every Thursday. {Recreations:}There are facilities for football, cricket and tennis. Snooker and darts are played at the clubs. Gardening and walking are popular. {Religion:}Church of England clergy from Petersfield hold services in St Mary's Church. Methodists and Roman Catholics travel to Petersfield for their services.{Trade:}There is 1 shop in the village which acts as a general store and post office. {Transport: Southdown buses run every hour to Petersfield and Portsmouth. They are used by elderly people. Age Concern send a mini-bus every Friday.
